text: his defense team say he's suffering from
affluenza a popular term for children
from wealthy families who have a sense
of entitlement and make excuses for poor
behavior 16 year old Ethan couch was
three times the legal drinking limit and
speeding when his truck crashed into and
killed four pedestrians
earlier in the evening he and his seven
passengers had stolen two cases of beer
from a shop the teenager from North
Texas pleaded guilty to four counts of
intoxication manslaughter and faced up
to 20 years in prison but a juvenile
court judge decided he would be better
served by 10 years probation and
enrolling in a private rehabilitation
center paid for by his parents his
lawyers say his family's wealth and lack
of parental oversight justify the
judge's decision but many of the
relatives of those killed are stunned he
may think he's gotten away with
something but he hasn't done and we
would do anything my wife and daughter
are gone and there were absolutely no
consequences
critics say the ruling reeks of double
standards for the rich and poor the
rehab center will cost Ethan's parents
four hundred and fifty thousand dollars
a year Emily Thomas BBC news
